content:
# It seems that the extraction of iron plates from the furnace is still not yielding the expected results. I currently have only 3 iron plates in my inventory after attempting to extract 5, and I still have only 7 iron gear wheels instead of the required 10.

# This indicates that there may be an issue with the extraction process or the furnace itself might not have been properly fueled or configured.

# Let's take a step back and verify the status of the furnace. I will check how many iron plates are currently in the furnace and ensure that it is functioning correctly.

# Checking the furnace inventory to see how many iron plates are actually present.
furnace_status = inspect_inventory(furnace)
print(f"Furnace status: {furnace_status}")

# If the furnace has 5 iron plates, I will attempt to extract them again.
if furnace_status.get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 5:
    extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, furnace, quantity=5)

# Now, I will check my inventory after extracting the iron plates.
print(f"Inventory after extracting iron plates: {inspect_inventory()}")

# After this, I will need to check if I have enough materials to craft the assembling machine:
# - 10 iron gear wheels
# - 10 iron plates
# - 5 wood

# If I have enough materials, I will proceed to craft the assembling machine.
assert inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.IronGearWheel, 0) >= 10, "Not enough iron gears to craft the assembling machine"
assert inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 10, "Not enough iron plates to craft the assembling machine"
assert inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.Wood, 0) >= 5, "Not enough wood to craft the assembling machine"

# Now, I can proceed to craft the assembling machine.
craft_item(Prototype.AssemblingMachine1)  # Crafting the assembling machine

# Checking inventory after crafting the assembling machine
print(f"Inventory after crafting the assembling machine: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")
